intro: Hieracium littuanicum, commonly known as the Lithuanian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe, including Lithuania. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it produces yellow or reddish-orange flowers. Hieracium littuanicum is a perennial herb with a robust root system and hairy stems. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and have a rough texture.
